publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2683 Trish Godman: Scottish Veterans of the International Brigade-That the Parliament offers warm greetings to the very small band of Scottish veterans of the British Battalion of the International Brigade; notes that they and their late Scottish comrades formed a full 25% of the British Battalion; acknowledges their courage and radical determination to assist the democratically elected Spanish Government in stemming the ugly tide of fascism so many years ago, at a time when some European governments sought to appease the fascists in Spain, Germany and Italy; recalls that these Scottish veterans, along with other veterans of the International Brigade, were honoured by the Spanish Government on the 60th Anniversary of the Spanish Civil War with honorary Spanish citizenship, and offers its best wishes to these distinguished Scottish veterans of a distant war against fascism.

S1M-2683 Trish Godman: Scottish Veterans of the International Brigade-That the Parliament offers warm greetings to the very small band of Scottish veterans of the British Battalion of the International Brigade; notes that they and their late Scottish comrades formed a full 25% of the British Battalion; acknowledges their courage and radical determination to assist the democratically elected Spanish Government in stemming the ugly tide of fascism so many years ago, at a time when some European governments sought to appease the fascists in Spain, Germany and Italy; recalls that these Scottish veterans, along with other veterans of the International Brigade, were honoured by the Spanish Government on the 60th Anniversary of the Spanish Civil War with honorary Spanish citizenship, and offers its best wishes to these distinguished Scottish veterans of a distant war against fascism. Supported by: Dorothy-Grace Elder*
S1M-2683 Scottish Veterans of the International Brigade (lodged on 31 January 2002) Stewart Stevenson*, Kay Ullrich*, Irene Oldfather*

S1M-2683 Scottish Veterans of the International Brigade (lodged on 31 January 2002) Donald Gorrie*, Robin Harper*, Mr Michael McMahon*, Marilyn Livingstone*, Michael Matheson*, Alex Neil*, Tommy Sheridan*
